mdRecord.dcterms:title: To the Hon. the General Assembly of Virginia: The petition of the undersigned, citizens of the county of <blank> respectfully represents, That on the 2nd day of October, 1848, a Convention .. assembled in Staunton, for the purpose of considering what measures should be recommended to the General Assembly of Virginia for the promotion of the cause of Internal Improvement
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Discusses communication and transportation through the West using canals and/or railroads and recommends extending the "Louisa Rail-Road, which has already been constructed to a point near Charlottesville, and is now under contract to the Eastern base of the Blue Ridge" rather than frittering "away the resources of the state in half a dozen improvements radiating from Richmond ..." Asks for government help in removing the natural barrier of the Blue Ridge Mountains.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Printed petition, unsigned, and without name of county. From the Stuart-Baldwin Papers, MSS 10378.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Transportation and state--Virginia
Railroads and state--Virginia
Public works--Virginia
